fields.headline: Nathalie
fields.bodyText: You discover from a text message that your husband is having an affair. Do you: a) have a big row and walk out; b) sulk for a week or two; or c) find a hooker who looks like Emmanuelle Béart and pay her to seduce him? The answer, in Nathalie, is c), a solution most husbands would settle for, and the upshot is that Béart spends most of the film giving graphic sexual descriptions to cuckolded wife Fanny Ardant. Since we never see husband Gérard Depardieu doing the aforementioned acts, you wonder how realistic these decriptions are, and this keeps a very odd film reasonably interesting, though for some Béart pouting her way through what sounds like the letters page of a porn mag will be enough. The film doesn't seem to be trying for realism in any area - the brothel where Ardant runs into Béart is red from ceiling to floor, and Ardant's occupation is gynaecologist. There's also a would-be wooer of Ardant whose date music is Joy Division. It's halfway to a blatant parody like 8 Women, in which both actresses recently appeared.
